enum.name: nv50_reg_mode
enum.brief: selects how $r regs are layed out inside the MP.

value.name: PACKED
value.doc: limits lanes/warp to 16 as a side effect.

enum.name: NVE4_IMAGE_FORMAT
enum.doc: These are used for the nve4 SUSTP instruction. They correspond to the internal format values used for RT formats.

value.name: INVALID_OPERATION
value.brief: Any of the following: - you used invalid param to QUERY_GET method - you used a TIC/TSC entry over TIC/TSC limit - you changed STRMOUT parameter without disabling STRMOUT first - ...

value.name: INVALID_VALUE
value.brief: You used too big / too small / unaligned value.

value.name: INVALID_ENUM
value.brief: Invalid value for an enum bitfield/register.

value.name: INVALID_OBJECT
value.brief: You used object of invalid class as param to one of 0x180-0x1fc methods.

value.name: READ_ONLY_OBJECT
value.brief: You used read-only DMA object for a write-only DMA slot.

value.name: SUPERVISOR_OBJECT
value.brief: You tried to bind a DMA object with the SUPERVISOR flag set.

value.name: INVALID_ADDRESS_ALIGNMENT
value.brief: One of your addresses is unaligned.
value.doc: Usually, unaligned addresses trigger INVALID_VALUE immediately on the address method. However, sometimes [m2mf for example] the required alignment depends on other state, and cannot be checked immediately. In this case, you instead get this error when you actually try to launch something.

value.name: INVALID_BITFIELD
value.brief: You had non-0 value in bits not corresponding to any bitfield.

value.name: BEGIN_END_ACTIVE
value.brief: You tried changing stuff while begin/end was active.

value.name: SEMANTIC_COLOR_BACK_OVER_LIMIT
value.brief: You tried to use a back color slot out of range of VP/GP outputs.

value.name: VIEWPORT_ID_NEEDS_GP
value.brief: You tried to enable VIEWPORT_ID without enabling GP.

value.name: RT_DOUBLE_BIND
value.brief: You bound more than one set of FP outputs to given RT index.

value.name: RT_TYPES_MISMATCH
value.brief: You tried to use tiled and linear RTs simultanously.

value.name: RT_LINEAR_WITH_ZETA
value.brief: You tried to use linear RTs with ZETA enabled.

value.name: FP_TOO_FEW_REGS
value.brief: You allocated too few registers in FP to cover all outputs.

value.name: ZETA_FORMAT_CSAA_MISMATCH
value.brief: You tried to use CSAA with non-CSAA ZETA format, or the other way around.

value.name: RT_LINEAR_WITH_MSAA
value.brief: You tried to use linear RTs with MSAA/CSAA enabled.

value.name: FP_INTERPOLANT_START_OVER_LIMIT
value.brief: You tried to use a slot out of range of VP/GP outputs for FP interpolant start.

value.name: SEMANTIC_LAYER_OVER_LIMIT
value.brief: You tried to use a layer slot out of range of VP/GP outputs.

value.name: RT_INVALID_ALIGNMENT
value.brief: You tried to use tiled RT without 0x100-byte alignment.

value.name: SAMPLER_OVER_LIMIT
value.brief: You tried to BIND_TSC a sampler not defined by TEX_LIMITS.

value.name: TEXTURE_OVER_LIMIT
value.brief: You tried to BIND_TIC a texture not defined by TEX_LIMITS.

value.name: GP_TOO_MANY_OUTPUTS
value.brief: You tried to reserve more GP output space than the MP has available.

value.name: RT_BPP128_WITH_MS8
value.brief: You tried to use 8xMSAA with 128bpp RT.

value.name: Z_OUT_OF_BOUNDS
value.brief: Your z coord exceeds the depth of your surface.

value.name: XY_OUT_OF_BOUNDS
value.brief: Your x/y coords exceed the size of your surface.

value.name: VP_ZERO_INPUTS
value.brief: You tried to submit vertices with VP input mask (VP_ATTR_EN) set to 0.

value.name: CP_MORE_PARAMS_THAN_SHARED
value.brief: You tried to launch block with more params than allocated s[] space.

value.name: CP_NO_REG_SPACE_STRIPED
value.brief: You tried to use too much registers per block, and it didn't fit, with striped reg mode.

value.name: CP_NO_REG_SPACE_PACKED
value.brief: You tried to use too much registers per block, and it didn't fit, with packed reg mode.

value.name: CP_NOT_ENOUGH_WARPS
value.brief: Your block requires more warps than MP can handle.

value.name: CP_BLOCK_SIZE_MISMATCH
value.brief: The XYZ dimensions of block you specified indicate a smaller block than BLOCK_ALLOC implies.

value.name: CP_NOT_ENOUGH_LOCAL_WARPS
value.brief: Your block requires more warps than LOCAL_WARPS allows..

value.name: CP_NOT_ENOUGH_STACK_WARPS
value.brief: Your block requires more warps than STACK_WARPS allows.

value.name: CP_NO_BLOCKDIM_LATCH
value.brief: Your didn't use BLOCKDIM_LATCH between block dimension setup and kernel launch.

value.name: ENG2D_FORMAT_MISMATCH
value.brief: The dst/src format combination you chose doesn't make sense.

value.name: ENG2D_OPERATION_ILLEGAL_FOR_DST_FORMAT
value.brief: The OPERATION isn't possible with the chosen destination format.

value.name: PRIMITIVE_ID_NEEDS_GP
value.brief: You tried to enable PRIMITIVE_ID without enabling GP.

value.name: SEMANTIC_VIEWPORT_OVER_LIMIT
value.brief: You tried to use a viewport index slot out of range of VP/GP outputs.

value.name: SEMANTIC_COLOR_FRONT_OVER_LIMIT
value.brief: You tried to use a front color slot out of range of VP/GP outputs.

value.name: LAYER_ID_NEEDS_GP
value.brief: You tried to enable LAYER_ID without enabling GP.

value.name: SEMANTIC_CLIP_OVER_LIMIT
value.brief: You tried to use a clip distance slot out of range of VP/GP outputs.

value.name: SEMANTIC_PTSZ_OVER_LIMIT
value.brief: You tried to use a point size slot out of range of VP/GP outputs.

value.name: RT_LINEAR_WITH_ZETA_NVC0
value.brief: You tried to use linear RTs with ZETA enabled.

value.name: ENG2D_UNALIGNED_PITCH_NVC0
value.brief: You tried to use a linear src/dst with pitch not aligned to 128.
